title.rendered: How to Undelete an Audio File on Android

content.rendered:
Recorded something important and accidentally deleted it? No worries, we’ve helped out millions of people who did the same thing. With Dumpster, a top rated Android Tool, you’ll be able to undelete that audio file faster than you can say “MP4.”

How to Restore Audio Files on Dumpster

Dumpster is able to recover most file types! You can view the entire list of supported files here. All popular audio file types are supported: MP3, MP4, FLAC, WAV, WMA, and AAC.

Here’s how Dumpster is able to recover deleted audio files: 

Once you download Dumpster, it will immediately start restoring any deleted files. As soon as the files are detected they’ll start populating in Dumpster’s Recycle Bin.

All you need to do is open the Recycle Bin, and tap on the file you want to restore back on your device.

Moments later, the file will return to its normal state on your Android device. 

Whether you deleted a song, podcast recording, voicemail, or an audio reminder, odd are, Dumpster will be able to restore it.

What are you waiting for? Try it Free Today!
